text: From where I sit, the *alleged* slander is secondary to the reaction of @MattSmethurst, which was totally uncalled for. He disparaged me personally. He could have messaged me privately or, better yet, directed his concern to the ACTUAL source of the article and THEN come to me.

author: D_B_Harrison

author: D_B_Harrison

text: Well, I didn't need to study poverty in college. I lived it. And I know what it takes to overcome it. And unless and until people stop trying to find fault, they will continue wallowing in their circumstances. Discrimination is a heart issue and government can't change hearts!
author: D_B_Harrison

text: Poverty is not always due to external circumstances one encounters. Both my parents had only a high school education. Never ONCE did they ever blame segregation or racism for our socio-economic status. Never. We were raised to neither complain nor blame. We simply persevered.
author: D_B_Harrison

text: That experience isn't any more real-world than mine. I know ATL like the back of my hand; lived ONLY in public housing until I graduated high school; ate government food that my mom would bring home from the public school cafeteria she worked at. Racism is no longer to blame.
author: D_B_Harrison

text: The podcast I host, @podcast_just, did an episode just last week on The Born-Alive Act. You may be interested in listening to it. http://thebarpodcast.com/JT/index.php/2019/03/03/jt-episode-on-the-born-alive-act/ …
author: D_B_Harrison

text: I was born and raised in ATL. I grew up literally across the street from the Ashby St. MARTA station (on Harwell Street - dead end street). Please don't blame racism on the conditions in that area, okay? That's not the reason why areas like the West End are in that condition.
author: D_B_Harrison

text: I'm curious, how do you go about determining to what degree your current amount of "privilege" is "unjust"? Conversely, how do you intend to go about remedying the unjust privilege you have? After all, you do have to remedy it, don't you?
author: D_B_Harrison

text: I get that a lot. LOL!
author: D_B_Harrison

text: There was a MUCH better way to handle this, Matt. I checked your profile in an effort offer you my cell number so we could talk, but I cannot message you. I'm not associated in ANY way with the content o the article, so "disagreement" is not even the issue.
author: D_B_Harrison

text: It's interesting that you place the onus on me to retract an article I didn't write, as opposed to suggesting @MattSmethurst retract his blatant insinuation that I, somehow, had something to do with the article's contents.
author: D_B_Harrison

text: Look, if you've taken offense at the article, I'd suggest you address your concerns directly to the author of the article, which is NOT me.
author: D_B_Harrison

text: Um, I didn't write the article, Matt.
